intro: Eriogonum gracile var. cithariforme, commonly known as the slender globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds, which are dispersed by wind. This species is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting pollinators.
